intro: Talinum crassifolium, commonly known as red-rooted nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It features large, broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its roots are thick and fleshy, which help it store water in arid environments. Talinum crassifolium is often found in moist, well-drained soils near streams or in open woodlands.
